content:
Okay, I see that George is to the southeast of me, and there are two "annoyed" NPCs to the east. My priority is to turn them back into quiet NPCs. I'll start by moving to the right to get a better angle.

Action: 3

Okay, I see that I am currently at row 5, col 10, and there are two "annoyed" NPCs to my right (row 5, col 17 and row 5, col 18). There's also a George potentially turning "quiet" into "annoyed" at row 6, col 18 (marked as *). My priority is to transform the "annoyed" NPCs back to "quiet" ones. I will move to the right to get closer to the "annoyed" NPCs, and then use a cigarette to turn them back.

Action: 3
I'm moving RIGHT to get in range to shoot the "annoyed" citizens with a cigarette.

Okay, I see George (@) is to my right and slightly below. There are two annoyed NPCs (&) directly to my right. My priority is to avoid George and convert the annoyed NPCs back to quiet ones. I will move up to create some distance from George and try to get a better angle to shoot the annoyed NPCs.

Action: 5

Okay, I see George (@) is to my right and slightly below me. There are two 'annoyed' citizens (&) above him, and one more that is mixed with him (*). I need to turn them back to quiet, and avoid George. I will move up and shoot cigarette.

Action: 5

Okay, I see the layout. I'm currently at (3, 11). There are "annoyed" NPCs to the right and George is below me. My priority is to turn "annoyed" NPCs back to "quiet" ones. I should move to (3,13), then turn to right and shoot.
Action:4

Okay, I see a few "annoyed" NPCs to my right. George is below me. I will move to the left, so I can shoot them.

Action: 2
```
I'm moving left to create space and aim at the "annoyed" NPCs to the right of my position.
```

Okay, I see the map. I'm currently at (4, 10). George is at (6, 19). There are two "annoyed" NPCs at (4, 17) and (4, 18), and two more at (5, 17) and (5, 18). There are also a good number of "quiet" NPCs scattered around. I need to turn the "annoyed" NPCs back to "quiet" NPCs before George gets to them. George is quite far, so I have some time. The "annoyed" NPCs are close to each other. Let's move up to get a better angle to shoot them.

Action: 5

The avatar is at (3, 10). George is at (4, 20) and there are "annoyed" NPCs at (4, 18), (5, 18). Also, George is currently converting someone into an annoyed person at (4, 19) and (5, 19). I need to move away from George and towards the left side of the screen where there are more "quiet" NPCs, and try to convert those "annoyed" NPCs back into "quiet" ones later.

Action: 2
```Action: 2```
I will move left to create some distance from George.

Okay, I see George (@) is approaching from the right, and there are 'annoyed' entities (&) nearby as well, and some 'quiet' entities (#) also on the right. I need to prioritize avoiding George first and foremost. Since George is on my right (col=20), and there are walls above and below me, I should move to the left to create some distance.

Action: 2
```Feedback: Moving left to create distance from George and avoid immediate danger.```

Okay, I see that George is currently turning a quiet into an annoyed at (2,20), and there are other annoyed at (1,19), (1,20), (2,19), (4,17), (4,18). I need to turn the nearest annoyed back to quiet, which is at (2,20).
Action: 3
I will move right, hoping to get in line with the annoyed and george to shoot a cigarette and turn them back into quiet.

Okay, I see two '*' (annoyed george) at (2,19) and (2,20). There are also two '&' (annoyed) at (3,17) and (3,18) and another two at (4,17) and (4,18). My avatar is at (3,9). I should move up and then use cigarette to transform the '*' and '&' back to '#'. I will first move up.
Action: 5

The avatar is at (2, 9). There are "annoyed george" to the right at (1, 19), (1, 20), (2, 19), and (2, 20), and "annoyed" at (3, 17), (3, 18), (4, 17), (4, 18).
I should shoot at the "annoyed" to turn them back to "quiet".

Action: 3
I will move right to get in line with some "annoyed".
```Action: 3```

The avatar is at (2, 10). George is at (1, 18) and (2, 18), and there are two 'annoyed george' at (1,19) and (2,19). There are also two 'annoyed' at (4, 18) and (5, 18).
I should move away from George and the 'annoyed george', and towards the 'annoyed'.
I will move up to prepare to turn 'annoyed' into 'quiet'.
Action: 5

The avatar is at (1, 10). There are two 'annoyed' NPCs at (1, 19) and (2, 19), and two 'George' at (1,18) and (2,18). I need to turn the 'annoyed' NPCs into 'quiet' ones by shooting them with cigarettes, and also avoid George. Given the positions of the 'annoyed' NPCs and 'George', moving right to (1, 11) and then shooting at the 'annoyed' NPC at (1, 19) seems to be a good first step.
Action: 3
I will move right to prepare for shooting at the annoyed NPC.

The avatar is at (1, 11). There are 'annoyed' NPCs to the right of the avatar. George is also located to the right of the avatar. There are quiet NPCs to the left of the avatar. To avoid George and convert the 'annoyed' NPC back to 'quiet', I will move up.
Action: 5

The avatar is at (1, 11). George is at (1, 17) and (1, 18), and there is an annoyed at (1, 19).
There are several "quiet" citizens to the left.
I need to turn the "annoyed" back to "quiet".
Action: 1
I will use the cigarette to turn the annoyed person to quiet.

The avatar is at (1, 11). George and a quiet person are at (1, 15), so George is converting a quiet person to an annoyed person. It is also surrounded by 4 annoyed people. I should move up to avoid George.
Action: 5
I expect to move up and away from George.

The avatar is at (1, 11). George is at (2, 15), and there are "annoyed" enemies at (1, 16), (1, 17), (1, 18), (1, 19), (2, 17), (2, 18), and (2, 19), one "george annoyed" at (1, 15) which is more dangerous.
I should move away from George and the "annoyed" enemies first and then shoot them. I will move to the left.
Action: 2
I expect the avatar to move to the left.

Okay, I need to survive and turn the "annoyed" characters back to "quiet" ones. George is dangerous, and I need to avoid him. I have limited cigarettes.

Currently, I'm at (1, 10). George is at (1, 14), and there's a George *and* annoyed enemy at (1, 15), followed by several annoyed enemies on the right. There are "quiet" characters to my right and behind me, along the left of the screen. Since george is getting close, I need to move. Let's move UP, which is away from the nearest danger.

Action: 5

Okay, I see a lot of "annoyed" (&) NPCs to the right and George (@) is near them. I should move away from George and try to convert the annoyed characters. First, I need to move away from George, so I'll move left.

Action: 2

The avatar is at (1, 9). George is near some quiet and annoyed citizens at (2, 13) and (3, 13). There are many annoyed citizens around. I should prioritize turning the "annoyed" citizens near george back into "quiet" ones to prevent George from transforming more quiet citizens. I will move up to get closer to the group of annoyed citizens and George.
Action: 5
I expect to move up, closer to George and the annoyed citizens, so I can potentially shoot a cigarette at them next turn.

The avatar is at (1, 9). There are a lot of "annoyed" entities to the right of the avatar. George is at (2, 12) and (2, 13) and is moving toward quiet. I will move up to create some distance from George and line up to shoot the annoyed.
Action: 5

The avatar is at (1,9). George is at (3,13) and moving towards quiet at (3,12). There are many "annoyed" entities to the right. I will move up to avoid George.

The avatar is at (1,9). George is at (3,13) and there is a George quiet at (3,12) and annoyed george at (3,12), so I should move away from George. There are many "annoyed" people nearby, so I should shoot them to turn them back to "quiet" ones. However, George is too close, so I should move away first. I will move up to avoid George first.

To survive, I need to move away from George, and turn the annoyed back to quiet ones. First move down.

There are quiet NPCs at (3,1), (3,2), (3,5), (4,1), (4,2), (4,5), (6,5), (7,5). I need to move away from George. Moving to the left would be a good start to distance myself from the immediate threat.

```Action: 2```

My primary goal is to avoid George. Moving up or down will immediately lead to death. My best bet is to move left and try to put some distance between the avatar and George.
